page.title: 06FRUIT FARM - OFFCHURCH.
page.content: { Burnt Heath Fruit Farm, Fosse Way, {Offchurch,}became a{"Pick Your Own"}in 1977. Acreage of fruit grown includes Strawberries 18, Raspberries 18, Black and Red Currants 3, Gooseberries 3. {The picking season}begins in mid- June when gooseberries, strawberries, raspberries and finally currants, ripen.The public may pick their own or buy fruit picked by 100 casual workers. Much of this fruit is frozen. { Rasberries}are{blast frozen}in 10lb open trays for 10 hours and stored in deep freezers in 5lb plastic bags. They are{exported,}via an agent to {Germany.} {Irrigation}of fruit is from the farm reservoir. { Raspberries}are cropped bi-anually to increase yield and simplify pruning. { Strawberries}are cropped for 3 years followed by wheat.
